Vitamin and mineral supplements could be used to fill in the gaps in one's diet. These supplements could be found at local health food stores or online.
Insect-based foods could be considered as an alternative source of essential nutrients. Insects are a rich source of protein, iron, and other vitamins and minerals.
Seaweed and algae could be utilized as a source of vitamins and minerals. These organisms are rich in iodine, vitamin K, and other essential nutrients.
Mushrooms could be used as a source of essential nutrients such as B vitamins, selenium, and potassium.
Meat and dairy products could be consumed in larger quantities to increase the intake of certain vitamins and minerals, such as vitamin D, iron, and calcium.
